TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AceType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines the available access control entry (ACE) types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks MaxDefinedAceType is the largest currently defined ACE type. Custom ACE types must be defined to have values larger than MaxDefinedAceType.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType AccessAllowed = unsigned int8(0)

Docs.summary: Allows access to an object for a specific trustee identified by an object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType AccessAllowedCallback = unsigned int8(9)

Docs.summary: Allows access to an object for a specific trustee identified by an object. This ACE type may contain optional callback data. The callback data is a resource manager–specific BLOB that is not interpreted.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType AccessAllowedCallbackObject = unsigned int8(11)

Docs.summary: Allows access to an object, property set, or property. The ACE contains a set of access rights, a GUID that identifies the type of object, and an object that identifies the trustee to whom the system will grant access. The ACE also contains a GUID and a set of flags that control inheritance of the ACE by child objects. This ACE type may contain optional callback data. The callback data is a resource manager–specific BLOB that is not interpreted.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType AccessAllowedCompound = unsigned int8(4)

Docs.summary: Defined but never used. Included here for completeness.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType AccessAllowedObject = unsigned int8(5)

Docs.summary: Allows access to an object, property set, or property. The ACE contains a set of access rights, a GUID that identifies the type of object, and an object that identifies the trustee to whom the system will grant access. The ACE also contains a GUID and a set of flags that control inheritance of the ACE by child objects.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType AccessDenied = unsigned int8(1)

Docs.summary: Denies access to an object for a specific trustee identified by an object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType AccessDeniedCallback = unsigned int8(10)

Docs.summary: Denies access to an object for a specific trustee identified by an object. This ACE type can contain optional callback data. The callback data is a resource manager–specific BLOB that is not interpreted.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType AccessDeniedCallbackObject = unsigned int8(12)

Docs.summary: Denies access to an object, property set, or property. The ACE contains a set of access rights, a GUID that identifies the type of object, and an object that identifies the trustee to whom the system will grant access. The ACE also contains a GUID and a set of flags that control inheritance of the ACE by child objects. This ACE type can contain optional callback data. The callback data is a resource manager–specific BLOB that is not interpreted.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType AccessDeniedObject = unsigned int8(6)

Docs.summary: Denies access to an object, property set, or property. The ACE contains a set of access rights, a GUID that identifies the type of object, and an object that identifies the trustee to whom the system will grant access. The ACE also contains a GUID and a set of flags that control inheritance of the ACE by child objects.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType MaxDefinedAceType = unsigned int8(16)

Docs.summary: Tracks the maximum defined ACE type in the enumeration.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType SystemAlarm = unsigned int8(3)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType SystemAlarmCallback = unsigned int8(14)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType SystemAlarmCallbackObject = unsigned int8(16)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType SystemAlarmObject = unsigned int8(8)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType SystemAudit = unsigned int8(2)

Docs.summary: Causes an audit message to be logged when a specified trustee attempts to gain access to an object. The trustee is identified by an object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType SystemAuditCallback = unsigned int8(13)

Docs.summary: Causes an audit message to be logged when a specified trustee attempts to gain access to an object. The trustee is identified by an object. This ACE type can contain optional callback data. The callback data is a resource manager–specific BLOB that is not interpreted.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType SystemAuditCallbackObject = unsigned int8(15)

Docs.summary: Causes an audit message to be logged when a specified trustee attempts to gain access to an object or subobjects such as property sets or properties. The ACE contains a set of access rights, a GUID that identifies the type of object or subobject, and an object that identifies the trustee for whom the system will audit access. The ACE also contains a GUID and a set of flags that control inheritance of the ACE by child objects. This ACE type can contain optional callback data. The callback data is a resource manager–specific BLOB that is not interpreted.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.AceType SystemAuditObject = unsigned int8(7)

Docs.summary: Causes an audit message to be logged when a specified trustee attempts to gain access to an object or subobjects such as property sets or properties. The ACE contains a set of access rights, a GUID that identifies the type of object or subobject, and an object that identifies the trustee for whom the system will audit access. The ACE also contains a GUID and a set of flags that control inheritance of the ACE by child objects.
